imdb.title: Haikyuu!!
imdb.plot: Determined to be like the volleyball championship's star player nicknamed "the small giant", Shoyo joins his school's volleyball club.

episodes.title: Special Edition! Youths Wagering the Spring High Volleyball Tournament
episodes.plot: This OVA was included in a limited edition release of the volume 27 of the manga. This special is a news broadcast that covers various volleyball teams in Miyagi as they fight for a ticket to the Spring Interhigh.

episodes.title: Introductions
episodes.plot: Hinata begins to feel left behind as Kageyama and Tsukishima are each invited to training camps and he isn't.

episodes.title: Lost
episodes.plot: Hinata must deal with the aftermath of his desperate ploy to join a training camp.

episodes.title: Perspective
episodes.plot: Hinata gains a new perspective on volleyball and tries to make the best of his new position.

episodes.title: Take It Easy
episodes.plot: With the help of Tsukishima, Hinata manages to join in on the free practice, and impress the others with his abilities. He later on notices and assists a seemingly struggling player.

episodes.title: Hunger
episodes.plot: The last day of training camp has come. Hinata is determined to finish strong with a higher skill level and as many newly acquired techniques as possible. At his own training camp, Kageyama is enjoying playing with many highly skilled players but is showing signs of struggling from his confrontation with Atsumu.

episodes.title: Enhancements
episodes.plot: Now reunited, the Karasuno players begin working on strengthening themselves and their skills in preparation for Nationals and Kageyama begins assisting Hinata in trying to improve his jump. As Kageyama continues to struggle with being labeled as a Goody Two-Shoes, Karasuno faces off against Date Tech in a practice match.

episodes.title: Return
episodes.plot: As they continue to play against Date Tech, the Karasuno team struggles with trying new methods, facing Date Tech's improved blocking and Kageyama's change in behavior.

episodes.title: Challenger
episodes.plot: The match between Karasuno and Date Tech stretches into an eighth set. With their time limited, Karasuno begins having Hinata blend into attacks in the attempt to overcome Date Tech. Meanwhile, Kinoshita finds himself aiding the team in various ways.

episodes.title: Everyone's Night
episodes.plot: On the first day of the New Year, Daichi is disturbed by a foreboding dream that burdens him as the time to head to the Spring Tournament draws near. The Karasuno team finally departs to Tokyo for the nationals tournament where nerves and excitement begin to arise as the players prepare for their first games and reunite with old friends.

episodes.title: Battle Lines
episodes.plot: Hinata's shoes suddenly go missing before the team's first game. Kiyoko embarks on the task of retrieving the shoes as she remembers how she first became the manager of the team. Karasuno faces Tsubakihara Academy in their first game.

episodes.title: A Chance to Connect
episodes.plot: Karasuno faces off against Tsubakihara Academy. At first, Kageyama isn't able to get used to the new venue, but he and Hinata do their quick attack and the crowd is in awe. Tsubakihara has a rather unique secret weapon.

episodes.title: Vivid
episodes.plot: Hinata gets to see Hoshiumi in action for the first time.

episodes.title: The Second Day
episodes.plot: Karasuno begin to prepare against Miya Atsumu's Team, Inarizaki, the second most likely team to win the entire high school national tournament.

episodes.title: Rhythm
episodes.plot: The first set between Karasuno and Inarizaki High takes place.

episodes.title: Found
episodes.plot: Karasuno begins to struggle against the Miya twins when they begin to use Hinata and Kageyama's Minus tempo quick attack against them.

episodes.title: Broken Heart
episodes.plot: Tanaka struggles in the first set against Inarizaki High.

episodes.title: Cats vs. Monkeys
episodes.plot: Nekoma play against a challenging opponent. Will they prevail?

episodes.title: Trap
episodes.plot: Nekoma faces off in the second set against Sarukawa tech in one of their most challenging sets yet. Sarukawa tech's plan on taking out Nekoma's setter, Kenma, gets set in motion.

episodes.title: The Ultimate Challengers
episodes.plot: Karasuno are in the midst of the second set against Inarizaki. Karasuno's line of defense begin struggling when Miya Atsumu begins to target his powerful jump float serves at Karasuno's Libero, Yuu Nishinoya.

episodes.title: Leader
episodes.plot: Nearing the end of the second set, Inarizaki begins to make Karasuno lose their momentum when Inarizaki's captain, Kita Shinsuke, makes his first appearance on court.

episodes.title: Hero
episodes.plot: Things begin to amp up with the beginning of the third set. Nishinoya struggles under pressure even more from Miya Atsumu's deadly jump floaters.

episodes.title: Pitons
episodes.plot: Inarizaki swing the momentum back to their side leaving Karasuno in big trouble. Hinata's hard work and dedication finally pays off.

episodes.title: The Birth of the Serene King
episodes.plot: Kageyama becomes his own proving that he is neither a goody-too-shoes nor a egocentric King.

episodes.title: Monsters' Ball
episodes.plot: The Grand Battle between Karasuno and Inarizaki High comes to a close. Who will come out the victor?!

episodes.title: The Promised Land
episodes.plot: Karasuno's second match against the ultimate competitors Inarizaki comes to an end with Karasuno coming out on top. Now they must prepare for their most anticipated game against their formidable rivals, Nekoma.

episodes.title: Greetings
episodes.plot: Karasuno is facing Shiratorizawa in the Miyagi Prefecture Qualifier finals of the Spring High School Volleyball Tournament. Is Karasuno strong enough to beat Shiratorizawa and their #1 ace spiker Ushijima? This is the start.

episodes.title: The Threat of 'Left'
episodes.plot: Nishinoya is having problems with Ushijima's left-handed spikes. How will the Guardian Deity of Karasuno overcome with this hurdle? .

episodes.title: Guess-Monster
episodes.plot: Hinata and Kageyama may have declared war on Ushijima, but, using his own style of blocking, Shiratorizawa's Tendo poses a more direct threat to the duo.

episodes.title: The Halo Around the Moon
episodes.plot: The last part of the 2nd set. Karasuno comes back at Shiratorizawa with Tsukishima and Nishinoya's total defense. They end up in a heated battle in the end, resulting in multiple deuces... Who will score the final point?

episodes.title: Individual VS Numbers
episodes.plot: Karasuno continues to adapt to fight against Shiratorizawa's overpowering strength. Meanwhile, Hinata must evolve his blocks if he wants to change the momentum of the game.

episodes.title: The Chemical Change of Encounters
episodes.plot: Remembering where they started from, the third years are determined to give this fight their all and make it to nationals. Meanwhile, the stamina of 4 sets is beginning to wear on Kageyama.

episodes.title: Obsession
episodes.plot: Karasuno is entering their first 5-set game. Will they have the stamina to endure the last set? It's Strength vs. Combinations!

episodes.title: An Annoying Guy
episodes.plot: Tsukishima is still out of the game with his hand injured. Narita subs in and Hinata continues to work on blocking. Sugawara squares off against Tendo's guess blocking.

episodes.title: The Volleyball Idiots
episodes.plot: Tsukishima finally returns to the court ready with strategies in mind. Karasuno is now able to catch up with their strong defense. With both teams running out of time-outs, it's the moment to decide who will come out on top.

episodes.title: The Battle of Concepts
episodes.plot: Karasuno, who were once named as the "Fallen Rivals" and "Flightless Crows", defeats Shiratorizawa with a score of 21-19. Tears of joy and mixed emotions burst through, as Karasuno resolves to win the upcoming Spring Interhigh Tournament.

episodes.title: Let's Go to Tokyo!!
episodes.plot: Ever since losing the Inter-High Preliminaries, Team Karasuno have been training like crazy. When their teacher-in-charge Ittetsu Takeda announces that Karasuno will take part in Nekoma's training camp in Tokyo, Coach Ukai's wishes may just come true.

episodes.title: Direct Sunlight
episodes.plot: Hinata, Kageyama, Nishinoya, and the other the sophomores head to Tanaka's place to study, but their new tutor is less than helpful. But they may be in luck when Hitoka Yachi, their potential new manager, steps in to help.

episodes.title: Townsperson B
episodes.plot: Yachi has mixed feelings about joining the team, and she is less than thrilled to ask her mother for advice for fear that she might disapprove. That's when Hinata steps in to help her overcome her fears.

episodes.title: Center Ace
episodes.plot: After finishing their grueling exams, Hinata and Kageyama are finally ready to join the team at the training camp. Just in time, too, because without them, Karasuno has been losing ... and badly. Can the power duo help turn things around?

episodes.title: Greed
episodes.plot: When Hinata admits to wanting to eventually compete by himself, he and Kageyama get into an argument which ends in the silent treatment between them, putting the whole team on edge.

episodes.title: Tempo
episodes.plot: Kageyama seeks advice from Oikawa about Hinata's solo dreams, while Coach Ukai takes Hinata to meet Karasuno's former club coach ... also for advice about Hinata's solo dreams.

episodes.title: Moonrise
episodes.plot: At Shinzen High's campus, Karasuno arrives for training, where they are matched with Fukurōdani Academy, one of the top schools. Soon Hinata realises that Kageyama's tosses have changed, and now he has to work harder!

episodes.title: Illusionary Hero
episodes.plot: Tsukishima starts to question his own training regime, while Akiteru trains extra hard, eager to become a member of Karasuno, which now includes Hinata's idol, the "Little Giant."

episodes.title: VS. "Umbrella"
episodes.plot: In a practice match against Nekoma, Hinata recognises that Kageyama is now tossing the way he used to, so Kageyama decides to practice on his own to give Hinata the exact tosses he wants.

episodes.title: Cogs
episodes.plot: As the training camp winds to a close, all the hard work of Karasuno's members begins to come together.

episodes.title: Above
episodes.plot: With Bokuto still down in the dumps, Karasuno learns the hard way why Fukurōdani is still one of the best teams in Tokyo. Later, everyone enjoys a barbecue as training camp comes to an end-and talk of the spring tournament begins.

episodes.title: Let the Games Begin!
episodes.plot: It's the first match of the Spring Tournament. Karasuno faces an opponent who hasn't yet learned the games not over until it's over.

episodes.title: A Simple and Pure Strength
episodes.plot: In their first match for the preliminaries, Karasuno are stunned to be pitted against Kakugawa High School, whose secret weapon is a freshman named Hyakuzawa who is 2 meters tall! While Hyakuzawa is intimidating, Karasuno soon snap into action...

episodes.title: Still Growing
episodes.plot: With the qualifiers still two months out, Tsukishima's brother invites him to practice with his own team. Meanwhile, Kageyama goes undercover to spy on Aoba Jōsai, and later, Karasuno heads back to Kanto to work on their new tactics.

episodes.title: Place to Play
episodes.plot: Team Karasuno finally arrive at the pre-lims, where they are matched up against Johzenji High School, whose motto is simply "To Play". Are Karasuno ready for what the unpredictable Johzenji have in store for them?

episodes.title: Next
episodes.plot: Karasuno's next match up shows Hinata that he isn't the only one who idolizes "the Little Giant".

episodes.title: The Battle Without Will Power
episodes.plot: After Daichi is injured, Ennoshita takes over as captain, and reminisces on how he had previously gave up on volleyball. Later, Yamaguchi subs in as an ace server, but will he be able to step to the plate?

episodes.title: The Losers
episodes.plot: As Aoba Jōsai's match against Dateko begins, team Karasuno struggle to stay in the game as their match against Wakutani continues ... with Sawamura still down for the count.

episodes.title: The Iron Wall Can Be Rebuilt Again and Again
episodes.plot: After Karasuno makes it to the semi-finals, their next opponent will be decided by a match between Aoba Jōsai and Dateko. But Aoba Jōsai have a secret weapon ... the gawky new guy, Koganegawa.

episodes.title: Wiping Out
episodes.plot: Karasuno begins their next match in the Preliminaries. If they want to fight Ushiwaka and Shiratorizawa then they're going to have to win. It isn't going to be easy.

episodes.title: The Destroyer
episodes.plot: Seijoh releases their Mad Dog and the rhythm of the game changes.

episodes.title: The Former Coward's Fight
episodes.plot: Yamaguchi is given a chance to redeem his former cowardice. Will his new found confidence prove justified?

episodes.title: Team
episodes.plot: As the final set of the semi-finals arrives, it's down to Karasuno and Seijoh. With both teams giving their all, Kyōtani's efforts are getting more and more out of hand during this last chance to win the third match.

episodes.title: The Absolute Limit Switch
episodes.plot: It's the last set and Karasuno is in the lead. Aoba Johsai and Karasuno try their hardest to win, with the thought that the strongest six would be the ones who claim victory.

episodes.title: Declaration of War
episodes.plot: Following their stunning victory, the Karasuno High School Volleyball Club finally move on to the Miyazaki Prefecture Qualifiers, where they will be facing the strongest school in the prefecture, Shiratorizawa Academy. Let the training begin!

episodes.title: OVA: VS Failing Grades
episodes.plot: Hinata and Kageyama must not fail their classes at all cost.

episodes.title: The End & the Beginning
episodes.plot: Hinata is inspired by the Small Giant playing volleyball on TV. Three years later, he goes to his first-ever volleyball tournament with his team and is set to play against the school of Kageyama Tobio, also known as the King of the Court.

episodes.title: Karasuno High School Volleyball Club
episodes.plot: After just joining the Karasuno Volleyball team, Hinata is faced with a new obstacle. His middle school rival, Kageyama, is also a potential member of the team. When the disapproving captain arrives, he quickly kicks them out until they can get along.

episodes.title: The Formidable Ally
episodes.plot: With sophomore Tanaka on their side, Hinata and Kageyama are up against freshmen Tsukishima and Yamaguchi and third-year team-captain Sawamura in a three-on-three match.

episodes.title: The View from the Summit
episodes.plot: Kageyama and Hinata both win their places on the team. But when the team's new coach, Ittetsu Takeda arrives, his announcement of a practice match with one of the top volleyball teams in the prefecture has both of them scrambling.

episodes.title: A Coward's Anxiety
episodes.plot: After the 3 vs 3, the first years are welcomed into the club as full members just in time for a practice match with Aoba Johsai. Will Hinata be able to handle the pressure of his first real match?

episodes.title: An Interesting Team
episodes.plot: Hinata and Kageyama are in full form, and it looks like victory is inevitable. But when Seijoh's captain Oikawa returns to the court, will Karasuno be able to fend off his super serves?

episodes.title: Versus the Great King
episodes.plot: Sophomore Nishinoya, the "Guardian God" of Karasuno Volleyball Club, returns to rally the other club-members during practice. Meanwhile, Takeda is still pulling for Keishin Ukai to be the next coach of Karasuno High-and he has a plan that just might work.

episodes.title: He Who Is Called "Ace"
episodes.plot: With the match against Nekoma looming, temp coach Ukai arranges an exhibition against his local volleyball association ... and now Azumane must prove he deserves his title.

episodes.title: A Toss to the Ace
episodes.plot: It's time for the Karasu versus Neighborhood Association team practice-match, where Asahi lives up to his title. With Hinata in pure awe of Asahi's gameplay, Kageyama makes moves to get Hinata back on track.

episodes.title: Yearning
episodes.plot: Gearing up for their match against Nekoma (and for the Inter-High preliminaries), the Karasuno team heads to training camp. But even with their much-improved skills, Keishin must make a difficult choice for setter: Kageyama or Sugawara.

episodes.title: Decision
episodes.plot: With the practice match against Nekoma fully underway, Karasuno seems to be the team to beat-thanks to the fearsome power of the Hinata-Kageyama duo. But Nekoma devises a clever and unexpected plan to reverse their losing streak...

episodes.title: The Neko-Karasu Reunion
episodes.plot: In an epic showdown, Nekoma and Karasuno battle it out for the win. Though Karasuno suffer a close defeat, the resulting alliance the two teams form could lead them to victory at the Nationals.

episodes.title: Rival
episodes.plot: With the Inter-High finals fast approaching, the pairings of the preliminaries are announced, and the tension is mounting amongst the members of Karasuno volleyball club. ?Meanwhile, not to be left out, Yamaguchi is secretly working on mastering his unique jump float serve.

episodes.title: Formidable Opponents
episodes.plot: Karasuno's first match at the long-awaited Inter-High preliminaries is against Tokonami High School. With Karasuno leading 3-0, it's becoming clear that Karasuno is back in action-and better than ever!

episodes.title: Revival
episodes.plot: While Karasuno seems to be winning against Tokonami, the outclassed team are determined to turn things around. Meanwhile, on the other court, the Karasuno girls' team isn't doing nearly as well...

episodes.title: Winners and Losers
episodes.plot: With the second match underway-this time between Karasuno and Dateko-Dateko's best tactic is their killer serves. Karasuno do their best to counter their serves, until pulling out their last ace: their own version of Nekoma's tactic "Pipe".

episodes.title: The Iron Wall
episodes.plot: With Hinata and Kageyama's clever moves, Karasuno is now in the lead against Dateko. But with Aone blocking, Dateko seems poised to flip the script. Now it's up to ace Azumane to show his skills, and break through Detoko's "Iron Wall".

episodes.title: Guarding Your Back
episodes.plot: The match vs Date Tech continues - neither team managing to gain a decisive lead. As the match nears it's end, Asahi steps up as Karasuno's Ace. Will he finally gain his revenge?

episodes.title: Conductors
episodes.plot: It's a head-to-head match between Oikawa and Kageyama, and it shows no signs of letting up. It turns out their competitive duel goes way back. During the match, Aoba Johsai pulls a tactic that threatens to send Kageyama into "King Mode".

episodes.title: Oikawa Toru is not a Genius
episodes.plot: Switching things up, Sugawara replaces Kageyama, giving the first win to team Aoba Johsai. But during the second match, Karasuno takes the lead ... until Oikawa's predictions start coming true.

episodes.title: Senpai's True Abilities
episodes.plot: Sugawara takes the court and throws off Aoba Johsai's rhythm. This gives Kageyama a chance to watch his senior in action.

episodes.title: Evolution
episodes.plot: After a grueling loss of the first set to Aoba Johsai, Karasuno is as determined as ever to win the second set and hang onto their chance to make it in the preliminaries.

episodes.title: The Point That Changes the Momentum
episodes.plot: Karasuno plays the third set against Aoba Johsai, fighting to move on in the spring preliminaries

episodes.title: Removing the "Solitary King"
episodes.plot: Karasuna and Seijoh are 24-24 in the third set and the rallies are getting longer and longer.

episodes.title: The Third Day
episodes.plot: The third year students have a tough choice to make as the entire team recovers from the tournament.

episodes.title: OVA: The Arrival of Haiba Lev
episodes.plot: The newest Nekoma team member arrives.
